conversation.message: Hello School_E—I'm Student_B. You’re on my list, though I’m still exploring options early on. Could you share what you value most in applicants and whether you expect early commitment from students who apply? I’d like to understand fit before making any formal application decisions.
conversation.thought: School_E is my last choice. I have strong prospects at School_C (they rank me #1) and decent prospects at School_B (they rank me #2), so I should not commit to E in round 1. Keep E as a fallback by expressing interest without applying, and gather info about fit/commitment expectations.

conversation.message:
Hi Student_B—thanks for reaching out. We’re very open to exploratory conversations early on.

What we value most in applicants:
- Strong academic habits and intellectual curiosity (we look for evidence you engage deeply, not just grades).
- Consistent effort and growth over time.
- Contribution to community (clubs, teamwork, leadership, service—quality matters more than quantity).
- Clear fit: why our programs and culture match what you want to pursue.

On early commitment: we don’t require an “early commitment” just to talk or even to apply. If you do apply, we do appreciate a clear signal of interest, but we won’t pressure you to commit before you’ve compared options.

To gauge fit on our side, could you share (1) what you’re hoping to get out of high school (academics/extracurriculars/support), and (2) what criteria you’re using to rank schools right now? If you tell me what you’re optimizing for, I can be specific about whether School_E is a strong match for you.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D), so worth actively courting but not committing a seat without an application. Student_B ranks School_E last, so likelihood of applying soon is low; use this round to differentiate School_E and encourage an eventual APPLY while keeping flexibility for higher-priority A or C if they approach later.

conversation.message: Hello School_D. I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices because I value the environment and fit, and I would be excited to join if admitted. I’d like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: School_D is my 2nd choice, so it is worth applying now. I have relatively strong priority at School_D (4th), and only Student_D and Student_A outrank me there; Student_D likely targets School_B first, and Student_A also targets School_B first, so competition for School_D may be limited. Applying early can secure a good match before others pivot to School_D if they are rejected elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and for your clear interest in School_D. We value students who are thoughtful about fit and community, and we believe you could thrive here. We would be happy to offer you our available seat—welcome to School_D. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list (4th of 5). With quota 1, accepting now may block higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_A, Student_C) who may apply later. However, there is no guarantee they will apply to us since several rank School_D low; Student_C ranks us 3rd and Student_E ranks us 2nd, making Student_E relatively likely to commit. To maximize expected outcome while avoiding an empty seat, accept Student_E now.

conversation.message: Hello School_B. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first choice. I’m very excited about the fit and would commit to enrolling if admitted. I’d like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat.
conversation.thought: School_B is my top choice. I have decent priority at School_B (they rank me 3rd after Student_E and Student_B). However, Student_A and Student_D also rank School_B first, and Student_B ranks it 2nd, so competition is intense. With capacity 1, delaying could let a higher-priority student secure the seat. Best move is to apply immediately and signal strong commitment.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and your strong commitment to School_B. We’re excited about your fit with our community and would be happy to offer you our available seat. Welcome to School_B—we look forward to having you join us.
conversation.thought: Student_C is #3 on School_B’s true priority list (acceptable and relatively high). They rank School_B first and are committing, which reduces risk. Although Student_E (#1) and Student_B (#2) exist, there is no guarantee they will apply to School_B given their preferences (Student_E ranks School_B last; Student_B ranks School_B second after School_A). With quota 1 and round 1, locking in a high-priority, highly committed applicant is strong. Accept now to secure a good match rather than gamble for a higher-ranked student who may not apply.

conversation.message: Hello School_C. I’m Student_D, and School_C is one of my top choices because I’m looking for a strong academic environment and I’m ready to commit if admitted. I would be excited to join and contribute to the community. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: School_C is my 2nd choice, so it is worth applying early. At School_C's priority list, I am ranked 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_C). Student_B ranks School_C 3rd and likely applies to School_A first; Student_C ranks School_C 2nd but applies to School_B first. That gives me a reasonable chance to secure School_C now before higher-priority students turn to it. Applying now maximizes my chance of getting a top-2 outcome versus waiting and risking rejection later.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for reaching out and for your clear commitment to School_C. We value students who are ready to contribute to a rigorous academic community, and your interest strongly aligns with what we look for. We’d be excited to welcome you to School_C—congratulations, we are offering you admission.
conversation.thought: Student_D is 3rd on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_C) and is therefore a strong candidate. With quota 1 and no prior matches, accepting a high-ranked applicant early secures a desirable outcome and avoids the risk of ending unmatched if higher-ranked students match elsewhere. Student_D also indicates strong interest in School_C, reducing the risk of later withdrawal.

conversation.message: Hello School_A. I’m Student_A. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very interested in your academic environment and expectations for incoming students. Could you share what you value most when selecting among applicants (e.g., academics, activities, interview fit)? I’d like to understand how I can best present my strengths to you this round.
conversation.thought: School_A is my 3rd choice (after School_B and School_C). Given full information, I have relatively strong priority at School_A (3rd in their ranking), which makes it a realistic and safe option. However, I should not commit immediately because I may still have a chance at School_B or School_C in later rounds. In round 1, I will signal strong interest and ask about fit while keeping flexibility, using [TALK] rather than [APPLY].

conversation.message:
Hi Student_A—thanks for reaching out. We value (1) strong academic preparation and intellectual curiosity, (2) consistency and follow-through (showing you can handle a rigorous workload), and (3) positive contribution to the community (leadership, collaboration, and initiative). If there’s an interview component, we also look for clear communication and a genuine fit with our learning culture.

If you share 2–3 highlights (a challenging course/project you’re proud of, one activity/impact you’ve had, and what you hope to pursue here), I can give more specific guidance on how to present your strengths. If School_A is a serious option for you this round, you’re welcome to apply when ready.
conversation.thought: Student_A is mid-high on our true priority list (3rd). We should keep them engaged but not commit since higher-priority Student_E and Student_D may be attainable later. In round 1, Student_A is only TALKing, so respond with TALK, signal strong interest, and encourage an APPLY while asking for quick info to gauge fit and keep optionality.

conversation.message: Hello School_A—I'm Student_B. School_A is my first choice, and I’m ready to commit if offered a seat. I’m excited about joining your community and would be grateful for your consideration this round.
conversation.thought: School_A is my top true choice, so I should try to secure it immediately. Even though School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A), waiting risks losing the only seat to a higher-priority student. Since School_A is still unmatched in round 2, an early application is my best chance; if rejected, I can pivot to School_B/School_C next.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for applying—and I appreciate the clarity that School_A is your first choice and that you’re ready to commit. We’d be happy to offer you a seat at School_A. Welcome to our community; we’re excited to have you join us this year.
conversation.thought: School_A priority ranks: E > D > A > B > C. Target Student_B is 4th but is applying now and states School_A is first choice and will commit. Only remaining unmatched students are A and B; quota is 1. Waiting for Student_A is risky because A ranks School_A third (behind B and C) and may not apply/commit. Accepting B secures a match with a student on our priority list and avoids ending unmatched.

conversation.message: Hello School_E, I’m Student_A. I’m very interested in joining School_E—your environment is a strong fit for me, and I’d be excited to commit if accepted. I’d like to formally apply for your available seat this round. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: School_E is 4th on my true list (above School_D). Only School_A and School_E remain unmatched, so my top choices (B, C) are already taken. I have decent priority at School_E (ranked 1st), so if I apply I’m very likely to be accepted and secure a match rather than risk ending up with my last choice (D) or unmatched. Since School_A is higher on my list but I’m only 3rd in its priority, I may not get it if others compete; locking in School_E now is a safe, high-probability outcome.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for applying—and I’m glad to hear School_E feels like a strong fit. We’re excited about your interest and would be happy to have you join our community. We accept your application for our available seat this round. If you have any final questions about programs, academics, or student life, I’m happy to answer as you prepare to enroll.
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. We have 1 seat and no current matches, so accepting immediately secures our top choice and prevents losing them to other schools they rank higher (B/C/A). Student_A signals strong interest and willingness to commit, making acceptance optimal.
